item.title: How we found a bug in Go's arm64 compiler
item.description: 84 million requests a second means even rare bugs appear often. We'll reveal how we discovered a race condition in the Go arm64 compiler and got it fixed.

item.title: nullpt.rs • Hacking GTA V RP Servers Using Web Exploitation Techniques
item.description: FiveM provides a powerful framework to create game experiences not otherwise possible in Grand Theft Auto. However, this power can be abused by attackers through the use of XSS in vulnerable NUI resources.

item.title: Irradiance Encoding, Ambient Cube
item.description: In Half-Life 2, a directional ambient term is precomputed across the environments and stored in the ambient cube lighting encoding. This post goes over the theory behind the ambient cubes technique...

item.title: Synology Reverses Policy Banning Third-Party HDDs After NAS sales plummet
item.description: Synology has backtracked on one of its most unpopular decisions in years. After seeing NAS sales plummet in 2025, the company has decided to lift restrictions that forced users to buy its own Synology hard drives.

item.title: Why I'm Pursuing Amateur Motorcycle Racing

To be truly good at something requires dedicating almost all of your free time to it—a constant obsession with how to get better. item.title: What Europe teaches the world about technology
item.description: How Europe’s human-centered approach to technology offers a healthy alternative to the speed-obsessed U.S. and the state-driven model of China — a vision of innovation built on ethics, balance, and quality of life.
